intro: Miersia myodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf miersia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Miersia myodes is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats.
